article.headline: Palantir headed for $22 billion valuation in Wall Street debut: report
article.body: Palantir Technologies Inc. is expected to fetch a lofty valuation in its transition to a public company despite an unusually aggressive governance structure, in the latest sign of investors’ voracious appetite for new shares. The data-mining-software specialist is eschewing the traditional IPO route and going public through a direct listing, in which a company floats its existing shares on a public exchange and lets the market determine the price. Ahead of a debut planned for Sept. 30, Palantir’s bankers have told investors the shares could start trading around $10 apiece, according to people familiar with the matter. That equates to a market valuation of nearly $22 billion on a fully diluted basis. In the private markets over the past year, Palantir’s stock PLTR, -0.50% has trended higher. The volume-weighted average price in August was $7.31 and in September, $9.17. Those average prices are likely to help determine Palantir’s reference price, the guidepost to where the stock could open in a direct listing. An expanded version of this report appears at WSJ.com.
